feed.title: Eli’s Blog
feed.subtitle: An easy to use blogging platform with support for Jupyter Notebooks.

entry.title: Night@Museum
entry.summary: Night@Museum Night at the museum is a night at del norte from 6-7:30 pm and this is a night where family, friends, and students can come to del norte and take a trip around all of the elective classes. Ceramics, 3d Animation, Ap Computer Science, Drawing/Painting, and AP Art studio were displaying their Final projects to Friends and family. ( This was a very fun night and I enjoyed looking at all of the art pieces and I can’t wait to be back again )

entry.title: Blogging about Video Roles
entry.summary: Cool Coders (Ava, Alexa, Antony, Shruthi) Period 4 There website is about creating a way to manage merchandise for ASB. Shruthi is the dev ops for the group and she has been working on delpoying the AWS. Ava is the scrum master and she has been helping everyone with individual assignments and overlooking everyhting to make sure it works. Alexa is the frontend and she has been working on the fastpages creating the looks of the website. Antony is the Backend and he has been creating tables using json and using buttons to manage how many products of each item they have. The cool coders used a stock api and created a list of items including hoodies and pants and then it prints the quantity of the item.

entry.title: Python Web API Endpoints using Jokes

link.title: Python Web API Endpoints using Jokes

entry.summary: A discussion on Web APIs. This is about creating a Web API (Jokes), and creating API that retains data as long as the Web Server is running. This is done using List and Dictionaries as the backend. Ultimately, this example could be extended by adding a database to the backend. However, for now, we are focussing on interaction of Frontend to Backend, this is called an Endpoint.
